page.title: 01Leavenheath
page.content: Typical of the gentle, smiling Suffolk countryside with its wide skies, the land of Constable and Gainsborough. Most of the area is within the potential A.O.N.B. extension to Dedham Vale. principally the high plateau of Leavenheath, enclosed 1815, but to the south and west the land fall sharply to the river Stour. Average rainfall 20 inches Soil, principally slightly alkaline bounder clay grade II Land use - arable farming, employment negligible. Most people work in service industries outside the area. There is an appreciable retired population. Arger Fen is part of an ancient woodland, some conifer planting,but much fo the indigenous woodland and ground flora remains.
